result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William John VonDoehren Jr.

defendant.name: VonDoehren, William John, Jr.
defendant.address: 549 River Street, P.O. Box 64, Taylors Falls, MN 55740

records.addlTxt: 1:37 PM Cases 22CM34 and 21CF312 called together.  Defendant William John VonDoehren Jr. in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for William John VonDoehren Jr.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Chapman: pleading to Count 2 of 21CF312- possess drug paraphernalia, remaining counts and 22CM34 will be DRI; lays basis.  State assures VR compliance, makes statement regarding basis for agreement.  Def affirms signature on and understanding of PLQ.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 of 21CF312 and orders a JOC; remaining cases/counts are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  Court orders $200 DNA only surcharge; def to pay in full within 2 weeks.  Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.
Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

9:58 AM Cases 21CF312, 22CM34, and 21FO365 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William John VonDoehren Jr. not in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for William John VonDoehren Jr.  Def FTA.  Case was on for motion hearing in 21CF312.  Atty Chapman updates Court: def made recent contact, will be late.  State asks Court to deny the motion and for warrant and forfeiture of any cash and to default in the FO matter.  Atty Chapman argues against denying motion for FTA.  Witness does not appear by any means either.  State asks to reset the motion hearing.  Court does not deny the motion, will reset it; finds def in default in 21FO365, assesses $200.50 for FTA.  As to criminal matters, court orders warrant and bond forfeited, $250 cash- only judge may quash.

Bond covers 22CM34 and 21CF312.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion. Defendant must comply with probation.  Defendant must pay $200.50 on 21FO365 within 30 days.  Off the record 10:53 AM for scheduling.

10:42 AM Cases 22CM34, 21CF312 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William John VonDoehren Jr. in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for William John VonDoehren Jr.  Cases recalled, def FTA to motion hearing as scheduled, but now appears late.  Atty Chapman asks Court to quash warrant; warrant is quashed.  Court not vacating decision to default on the FO matter.  Discussion of bond, no money posted.  Court sets $500 signature bond.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion. Defendant must comply with probation.  Defendant must pay $200.50 on 21FO365 within 30 days.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:58 AM Cases 21CF312, 22CM34, and 21FO365 called together.  Defendant, William John VonDoehren, appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: will be filing a motion on act 79 search, will continue negotiating.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:07 AM 21FO365, 22CM34, and 21CF312 called together.  Defendant William John VonDoehren in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  William John VonDoehren appeared by video means with Attorney.  Def appears from Pine County Jail.  Case 22CM34 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered.  Atty Chapman provides status- not settled.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on April 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on April 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:24 PM Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def fails to appear by any means.  Case was set for initial appearance.  Court reviews for service, notes another date is already set.  State requests to move this to the other date that is set 4/14/22 at 9:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
